line: Why don't you sit here?

line: She's adopted. Danny, it's me, Dana... Yeah, Merry Christmas to you, too... I, ah, I'm wondering if you can do me a favor... I need the complete case files on my sister, Melissa Scully. line: Agent Scully, it's been... what? 4 hours? I was getting worried.

line: I'd like to order an autopsy on Roberta Sim. There's a possibility she was murdered.

speaker: KRESGE
line: What? You got another phone call?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think that it may have been the husband.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Where did you get that idea? You want coffee?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Thanks.

speaker: KRESGE
line: He's got an ironclad alibi. Mr. Sim was at the doctor's office with his daughter. He was there all morning. I checked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I took another look at the police photos this morning. There were no hesitation cuts on Roberta Sim's wrists. Suicide victims seldom make the fatal cut the first time.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Seldom but not always. Is that all you got?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Why was the phone off the hook when you got to the Sim's house?

line: The wife took it off. I'm guessing she didn't want to be interrupted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your report says the husband called the police after he discovered his wife dead.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Yeah.

line: But if the phone was off the hook when you arrived, how did he call you? Did he find the phone off the hook, call you, then have the presence of mind to return it to the way that he'd found it? Does that make sense to you?

line: Stomach contents appear to include coffee, whole wheat toast and cantaloupe. No medicine tablets. Empty sample packets of doritriptan succina were found but I find no evidence that any of the pills were ingested.

line: No. I don't believe absorption would be that complete, not that close to her death.

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: Then how did the doritriptan get into her blood stream, Ms. Scully?

speaker: KRESGE
line: A needle puncture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: On the heel of her right foot. Extremely tiny and easy to miss. It was meant to be overlooked. I believe that this woman was injected, anesthetized so he wouldn't fight back. Then her suicide was staged.

speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
line: It's a possibility. Then again, it's possible this woman simply stepped on a tack and the rest is blue sky conjecture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I say it justifies opening a murder investigation.

line: This is your doing, isn't it? You didn't have the decency to leave me and my daughter alone?

line: Mom... sit down. The woman who committed suicide has an adopted daughter, a three year old named Emily. I got a sample of Emily's blood and I had the lab run a test on her DNA. speaker: MRS. SCULLY

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mom, it's uncanny. Emily looked exactly like Melissa. That's why I ordered the PCR test. Because her face may change, but her DNA can't.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: And the test is accurate?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a 60% chance that Melissa is Emily's mother. I'll order a more comprehensive test, a RFLP. It'll take a couple of days, then we'll be sure.

speaker: SIM

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lets get you right in there. Lets get you buckled in here nice and safe, ok? You like that, huh? I'll see you again soon, ok?

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: Every year my husband insisted on putting the angel on top of the tree by himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

line: Bill, I don't expect you to understand but I am not going to stand here and justify my motive.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: Dana, there's a telephone call for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? for you. Marshall Sim just confessed.

line: I've got a signed statement.

speaker: KRESGE

line: Just now.

line: Well, you're just in time. I was on my way over to the neighbors. Mom and Tara are already there. What? What happened?

speaker: BILL
line: My God. Do you know who did it?

line: No.

line: Do you think it has something to do with that little girl?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What dream?

line: To have a child. Look... I understand. I know the need. God knows Tara and I tried for years. But making this girl into Melissa's daughter is not the way. You're going to end up hurting yourself.

line: Hi. I'm here to see Dana Scully.

speaker: BILL
line: Ah, may I ask...

line: I'm Susan Chambliss from the county. It's about the adoption.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Thanks for coming in on Christmas Eve.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: Oh, not at all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand. I mean, I think I have a right to know why you're rejecting my application.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: It's not mine to accept or reject, Dana. We only make recommendations to the judge. But at this point I'd advise against you becoming an adoptive parent. One I sense you are deeply committed to and one which would overnight become a secondary priority to the care and well-being of this child. I'm not sure this is a sacrifice you're prepared to make.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's one I've given a great deal of thought to. I mean, to be honest, I've started to question my priorities since I was first diagnosed with cancer. I feel like I was given a second chance. Ever since I was a child, I've never allowed to let myself get too close to people. I've avoided emotional attachment. Perhaps I've been so afraid of death and dying that any connection just seemed like a bad thing... something that wouldn't last. But I don't feel that anymore.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: I know you are a trained physician and are aware of Emily's medical condition. I want to stress to you, Dana. Emily is a special-needs child. The bad news is, you'd have to relive it through the eyes of a child.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I realize that. And I feel like I'm ready.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: We'll review your final application and make our recommendations. I wish you luck. Merry Christmas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Merry Christmas.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: I'll show myself out.

line: Dana?

line: I guess I'm afraid of making a big mistake. I could tell Dad sure thinks I am.

line: I know that. You know, when I first started med school, it felt so right. It seemed like that was where I was supposed to be. And then by the time I graduated, I just knew it was wrong. But now the FBI feels right. And... what if that's wrong too?

line: There is no right or wrong. Life is just a path. You follow your heart and it will take you where you're supposed to go.

line: God! You sound like a greeting card. I don't believe in fate. I think we have to choose our own path.

line: Well, just don't mistake the path for what is really important in life.

line: Which is what?

speaker: MELISSA
line: The people you're going to meet along the way. You don't know who you're going to meet when you join the FBI. You don't know how your life is going to change or how you're going to change the life of others.

line: Hey!

line: Good morning, sleepy head.

line: Did Santa come?

line: Santa's right here.

line: Hey, Merry Christmas.

line: Ok, ok, enough pleasantries. I'm dying to know what's in this box. I've waited for a month.

line: Well, open it. This one's from Charles. Excuse me. I'll be right back.

line: I'll sign for it.

line: No, no. I need Agent Scully's signature, Sir.

speaker: BILL
line: Oh, all right.

line: I need you to sign for this. Merry Christmas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Merry Christmas.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: What is it?

line: It's the DNA test on Emily Sim's blood.

speaker: BILL
